Description: Category of metadata level (e.g., study level, file level, etc.); provide the same one for all items/rows.
The synIDs of related studies OR names of related studies not in Synapse
The stable, unique identifier for a study that never changes, even if other study metadata changes (like the study name, short name, owner, or project). Example: STUDY_SCA
The Synapse Project identifier (synID) with which this Study is related.
The short acronym for a project the study is associated with.
Name of the study

The synID of the wiki that contains the study description.Description of the study, including the types of experimental assays, model systems, types of analysis, description of cohort, associated vulnerable populations, special categories of data, rare diseases, etc. Maps to DUOplus2.
The short study description/abstract used to describe the study that is visible on the Portal study card.
The wiki from the CLASSIC Portal - backend that describes study metadata files
Grant number including activity code, institute code, and serial number (e.g. U01MH103392)
Name(s) of PI
Distinguishes original vs current vs co-PI
Valid Values:
Original PI
Current PI
Co-PI
Acting PI
Multiple
Unknown

Description: Email of (each) PI
Institution conducting study
The synID of the wiki that contains the protocol, study design and goals

Primary disease or condition focus of the study. A categorical descriptor summarizing participant health status selection and ascertainment context for a study cohort, intended to support discovery and comparison across studies.
Valid Values:
Normative/General Population,
At-Risk/Enriched Populations,
Condition-Focused Populations,
Mixed/Comparative Designs,
Registry/Administrative Cohorts

Description: Why participants were included: these categories describe participant health status at enrollment, not outcomes.
Valid Values:
Normative/General Health,
Condition-Focused,
At-Risk/Enriched,
Mixed Comparative

Description: Where participants came from: the categories describe sampling context, independent of diseas focus
Valid Values:
Community-ascertained,
Clinic-ascertained,
Administrative/Registry-Based,
Hybrid

Description: How restrictive enrollment was: the categories describe selection methodology
Valid Values:
Broad/Minimally Selective,
Moderately Selective,
Highly Selective,

Description: Types of input/output data in bioinformatics pipelines
Further qualification of dataType, which may be used to indicate the state of processing of the data, aggregation of the data, or presence of metadata.
For files of dataSubtype: metadata, a description of the type of metadata in the file.

Identifies a specific metadata artifact or file (i.e, a particular "measures.tsv" version, etc. If the file is uploaded to Synapse, this will be the Synapse file entity ID. Examples: syn99887766 (or FILE_STUDY_SCA_measures_v2)
Indicates whether the archived metadata describes all data collected in the study or only the data types made available for external access.
Valid Values:
Exhaustive (Collected), 
Shareable-only,
Mixed/Partial,
Unknown Scope

No,

Unknown

participant,
cohort

individual,
summary

arm,

Description: Free-text descriptor capturing key population characteristics not covered by controlled terms (e.g., “male veterans”, “older adults with caregiver support”).
An aggregate description of the amount and demographic composition of available data for a study, cohort, or variable, provided without individual-level records.
The time period or periods during which data were collected for a study, cohort, or variable, summarized at an aggregate level.
Earliest calendar year of data collection
Latest calendar year of data collection
Explicit list of years, if non-continuous. Four-digit integers (e.g., 2019)
Seasons during which data were collected
Valid Values:

Spring,
Summer,
Fall,
Unknown

Description: Free-text clarification (optional)
Unique identifier for the cohort
Name of cohort
Linked longitudinal study identifier
De-identified participant ID; unique to a specific study or program
The total number of unique participants for whom data are available within the specified study, cohort, or scope.
Other external identifier, if no GUID exists

Global Unique Identifier: unique across studies and repositories. If a participant has been assigned a global identifier (e.g., NDAR GUID), include it here to support linkage across studies and repositories. Otherwise, leave this field blank.

The age or ages of a participant at the time of enrollment or at defined enrollment-related timepoints in a study, including single ages, age ranges, or multiple ages associated with longitudinal or staged enrollment.
A named study milestone at which enrollment occurs (e.g., baseline, re-enrollment, extension phase).

The physical or situational setting in which a data collection activity or assessment is administered. Describes where data collection occurs, not how, who, or what. Intended for general or summary-level reporting, not per-participant metadata.
Valid Values:
Lab,
Clinic,
Field,
Home,
Remote,
Mixed,
Unknown

Description: A numeric value representing the fraction of a population associated with a given category, typically expressed as a percentage or decimal.

Adolescents (13–17),
Adults (18–64),
Older Adults (65+),
Mixed,
Unknown

Description: The biological classification of a participant, typically assigned at birth based on physical and genetic characteristics.

Intersex,

sexDistribution:

    - value: Male

A stable identifier for a defined component of a study (e.g., wave, arm, period) used to scope metadata summaries.
